articles.description: Ukrainians tell of their fear as BBC Verify analyses videos appearing to show drone strikes on civilians.
articles.title: Drone strikes on civilians suggest new Russian terror tactic in Ukraine

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: People tell the BBC how much they earn and what they made of the Budget.
articles.title: 'We earn £100,000 together. We are not worse off after the Budget'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Changes announced to inheritance tax rules could see the end of small family farms, warns the NFU.
articles.title: Farmers "betrayed" by Labour's £1m inheritance tax relief limit

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The government's fate will depend on whether it can make things better, says political editor Chris Mason.
articles.title: Chris Mason: A change-making Budget and a moment of jeopardy

articles.description: The president of the Andalusian government says the man suffered "several" heart attacks.
articles.title: British man, 71, dies after being rescued from floods in Spain

articles.description: Ella Adoo-Kissi-Debrah, who lived near London's South Circular Road, had a fatal asthma attack in 2013.
articles.title: Ella Adoo-Kissi-Debrah: Mum settles legal action over air pollution death

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Thom Yorke hit back at the fan after he heckled the singer over death numbers in Gaza during a performance in Melborne.
articles.title: Radiohead singer Thom Yorke walks off stage as fan shouts Gaza protests

articles.description: As a ban on protesting within 150m of abortion clinics is introduced, the BBC speaks to anti-abortion activists.
articles.title: My afternoon with protesters who stand outside abortion clinics

articles.description: A man from Dalston traces his stolen bike and leads the police to the door of the thief.
articles.title: 'I tracked a thief and got my bike back within 48 hours'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Reactions to the Budget, which saw large rises in both tax and public spending, lead the papers.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Reeves' £40bn tax gamble' and 'bombshell for Britain's strivers'
